item.title: Report E-2024110172
item.description:
Report E-2024110172

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: GREENSBURG
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver was reversing to position transport to offload and struck a bollard. Driver noticed a dumpster lid was open and got distracted resulting in the incident. This caused damage to the center of the rear DOT bumper and paint transfer on the concrete bollard.

item.title: Report E-2024110260
item.description:
Report E-2024110260

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0111 ET, XHG notified ERTS of a cargo release on their concrete dock. It was reported 12 ounces of Parts Cleaner and Degreaser released from 24, 12-ounce metal spray cans. The caller reported the release occurred due to forklift puncture during loading operations. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined terminal personnel can clean the release with PPE on site. The caller reported the release will be absorbed with oil dri and placed into a 15-gallon poly drum.
